website_summaries.verdict: A good lapel microphone with a 3.5mm jack that fits close to the wearer's mouth.
pros: Microphone clips onto the collar of a shirt for hands-free use
Omnidirectional pickup provides clear audio in all directions regardless of the user's position
cons: The microphone is prone to getting damaged if hit with the hands or other objects

customer_reviews.title: This is a great and inexpensive lavalier microphone!
customer_reviews.text: I've used quite a few lavalier microphones in the past for video creation and other audio needs. I have seen that this lavalier gets pretty good reviews all around so I decided to try it out for myself. This is a great mic, and the sound quality is at a level that compares to lavaliers that cost much more and a higher price point. Cons ---------- Cheap Plastic Build Quality Short Cable Clip is Awkward
customer_reviews.author: T is for Tech

customer_reviews.title: Good Product!
customer_reviews.text: Great mic. Clips on well; it spins to change the direction its facing; and sounds nice and crisp. I stand pretty close to the AC unit in my home when I use this, but it doesn't pick up bad background noise. I did mess up though and I thought it had a USB end but it doesn't (it has like a headphone plug end). My fault for not looking closer. But I bought an adapter that made it work and it was just fine. The wire on it I think could be a little longer, but overall, I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: 1) small and beautiful design Cons
customer_reviews.text: Pros: 1) small and beautiful design Cons: 1) must be powered from the recorder , it cannot work with normal phone or recorder cannot power the microphone. You must have a professional recorder before you use it. 2) the recording is too sensitive to environmental sound, not optimized for near voice. This means: too much noise recorded while weak in voice picking.
customer_reviews.author: SkyDiver

customer_reviews.title: If this is your price range, then this is the BEST MICROPHONE YOU CAN BUY for an Audio jack.
customer_reviews.text: If this is your price range, then this is the BEST MICROPHONE YOU CAN BUY for an Audio jack. I was looking for this forever and bought two PIECES OF AMAZON CRAPPOLA. I love Amazon, but this direct from China business model is going to BACKFIRE ON THEM at some POINT. I got a cheap umbrella that looked like BURBERRY on here. It came from China and when it arrived IT HAD BURBERRY STICKER. It wasn't BURBERRY. I'm just saying, Amazon is wonderful, until you don't know what your looking for. Then you get conned by their search engine that MAKES SURE CRAP FLOATS TO THE TOP.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Try this mic -- you really will be impressed.
customer_reviews.text: Wow! What clear sound I got using this with my Sony digital recorder. I found out how much better my voice was over the built-in mic. This has a good enough build quality for a $20 mic that I really can't find any fault with it. I use it when I want clear sound to take notes. With it kept a fixed distance from my mouth, there is no modulation compared to using a desk mic, for example, or a shotgun mic. The stereo separation adds a nice touch to my digital recordings and the stereo from this mic sounds better than using the spread mics built in to the digital recorder.
customer_reviews.author: GMC

customer_reviews.title: Tiny but powerful
customer_reviews.text: This microphone is very good, I was uncertain at first but i looked up several youtube videos to hear the mic test and it convinced me to purchase it. PROS: +Sounds crystal clear with nothing interrupting it, it does catch background noise too but that's fine with me as i don't plan on using this professionally. +Small and can clip anywhere +Cheap CONS -I noticed that package came in opened even though it was listed as "new". I'm hoping this won't bring any future problems such as this device expiring earlier than convenient. -Cable is short Great product, highly recommend it for amateur voice recording when you're tight on cash and want soothing that still sounds good.
customer_reviews.author: Lupescorvum

customer_reviews.title: Sound is clear, but it's too sensitive
customer_reviews.text: Although the mic has an overall good sound, it's far too sensitive with the placement of the the stereo microphones in a hammerhead design. It's very difficult to wear the mic without it picking up unwanted noise from clothes, long hair or just general movement. One side of the mic seems to always get in the way. Traditional mics allow for the recording section to be pointed out, away from friction. I would not suggest this microphone for the use.
customer_reviews.author: Robert S.D.

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding quality!
customer_reviews.text: Too tired to write a full review, but I have this and a few of the top lavalier mics that I used with the Tascam 05 recorder. This one has noticeably better sound quality, and costs less than my 45 dollar black lavaliers... you would have to pay 200+ to do better, but this is NOT an invisible mic. If you don't need to pretend like there isn't a mic on you and your main concern is great, natural-sounding audio then this is the lapel mic for you.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Naterman

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for $20!
customer_reviews.text: I needed something for gaming, but I already had a good pair of headphones, so I decided to get this and use this and my headphones with an adapter. It sounds better than most gaming headset microphones, and also has more applications. If you want want a simple way to make your phone vlogs to sound better, this mic will be closer to the source (you), and thus sound better. Good for on-the-go recording in general. I wouldn't use it for voiceover, I have a more expensive mic and audio interface for that, but I would not want to lug around that gear everywhere. Different mics for different purposes!
customer_reviews.author: Aisling

customer_reviews.title: so far my best motovlogging mic
customer_reviews.text: I use this with the Drift Ghost-X motovloging camera. After relocating the mic 3 times I finally have it in the least amount of wind buffeting spot inside the helmet and the sound quality is spot on. Only complaint really is I sound lower tone ( more bass in the voice?) on video than I do in person. But that is not entirely a bad thing. Oddly, my wife sounds spot on perfect when she is talking through it. I bought this due to it being used by MANY motorcycle motovlogers. And I can see why. It WORKS!
customer_reviews.author: Texas Coyote

customer_reviews.title: Does well out of the package
customer_reviews.text: This has been around a while. My Son has one and it has been excellent for him. I found it did well. Haven't tested it in gaming yet. Works very well in Discord. My son and I can understand each other. Hopefully it will also do well in gaming. Only negative I can think of is their packaging. Took a while to get it out. It could do with a little longer cable. I had to purchase an extension for it.
customer_reviews.author: Stilllearning

customer_reviews.title: Works Great on Windows 7 PC
customer_reviews.text: Just a quick review: I bought this Sony ECMCS3 Clip style Omnidirectional Stereo Microphone for my desktop PC which is using Win 7 Pro and updated sound card (Sound Blaster Audigy Fx). I works great with Audacity Recording Software. So for those wondering if this mic will work with a PC, I can confirm it does with my HP 6200 running Windows 7 Pro and Sound Blaster Audigy Fx sound card.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry K

customer_reviews.title: Crackling sounds when using mic for autox/track days
customer_reviews.text: It may be good for other recording purposes but for driving around if you go past 50 mph it starts to crackle. Had the mic with a wind sock(dead cat) underneath license plate above exhaust and it sounded good but would often crackle while hooked up to gopro hero 7. Bought an olympus me-51s and that mic does not crackle or cut off audio when driving at high speeds during autox/track driving. Sounds great and can handle loud exhausts unlike Sony ecmcs3
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Not for gopro
customer_reviews.text: This microphone did not work at all.even though it is a recommended microphone for the go pro, it would not pic up sound using the go pro microphone adapter
customer_reviews.author: LAWSONRANGER

customer_reviews.title: Great for gaming with friends and with Voice Attack. Much better than the Zalman or desktop microphone
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for gaming as I already have a pair of good quality headphones (Sennheiser RS 170). When worn (eg: clipped on to shirt) the quality is MUCH better than the Zalman or a desktop microphone. I've also used it just lying on my desk or clipped to my mouse pad which has given me quality similar to a desktop mic. Its also has worked well for me with Voice Attack. The speech recognition works great when clipped onto my shirt. I don't have to enunciate loudly like I had to with desktop mics. If you already have a quality pair of headphones and find you need a microphone for gaming this works great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very bright sound, doesn't come with foam covers
customer_reviews.text: It's basically unusable without a wind muff or cover. It's very sensitive and full range but it picks up every rustle of a person's shirt. Also, the attached cable should be longer. Returned it and looking at Rode to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: B Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Work With Mobile Devices
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this particularly to work with my mobile device. And yes, I know I have to use a mic and audio splitter. I tried that as well as a 2.5 to 3.5 adapter and this headset still didn't work even with either. However, the cheap $3 lav mic that I purchased from Ebay worked perfectly without any adapters. So I returned this and bought 2 more of the cheapos.
customer_reviews.author: MSRP is a joke

customer_reviews.title: Great mic for the price
customer_reviews.text: mic pics up and sounds great. Only con I've found is that there is considerable noise pick up caused by the cable rubbing on clothing, otherwise very clean sound. Not really unexpected on a mic at this price however so I still have to give it 4 stars. I'm going to try adding an extra insulator to the cable and see if that helps. Otherwise really happy with this mic. Also cable is a bit short but was able to add an extension cable with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Mancelh

customer_reviews.title: Oldie but goodie for voice recording.
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this for audio while creating online course content. Voice quality is very good, and so much better than my video cameras. I'm using it with an old Olympus digital voice recorder DM620, editing in Audacity when used without video, or Adobe Premiere with video. I clip it under my shirt, against my chest and get great sound quality without it showing.
customer_reviews.author: S.Wirth

customer_reviews.title: Ugly, but works very well
customer_reviews.text: Well it looks like I'm wearing a chrome hot dog but it doesn't work very well. I found the best solution for its ugliness by clipping it on underneath my shirt. The sound is not muffled! It's a perfectly acceptable solution. This microphone sounds great and produces nice surround sound. I bought several mics and this is the only one that I can work with my Sony recorder. So I'm happy but yeah I kind of wish that it didn't look like a tiny coffee mug.
customer_reviews.author: Cal Sand

customer_reviews.title: Works well with my GoPro helmet camera
customer_reviews.text: I am currently using this on my GoPro helmet camera. It works very well. I have a fuzzy attached to help block out wind noise, but I am really impressed at how well the microphone works. If you need to purchase an adapter, stay away from the $3 adapters on eBay. Buy one here on Amazon. It is well worth it. The cheap eBay ones break or just plain don't work. This microphone sounds very clear. My videos are uploaded to Youtube and sound amazing. I would highly recommend this microphone.
customer_reviews.author: Gracetoyou

customer_reviews.title: Huge Disappointment when used with ICD-UX533
customer_reviews.text: I attempted to use this with my Sony ICD-UX533 voice recorder by clipping it onto my sweater about 6 inches below my mouth. It did do a passable job of recording voice but it introduced an electronic 'hum'. I removed the microphone and placed the ICD-UX533 at approximately the spot I had tried the microphone. Voice volume and clarity were similar but there was no hum. Accordingly I can't see any advantage to using this microphone over just leaving the recorder in a shirt pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Tehamaddmh

customer_reviews.title: If used on a PC, get a good sound card!
customer_reviews.text: When I connected it to my Macbook Pro(2018), the sound is clear and really nice, when it's connected to my cheapo windows laptop with a cheap realtek onboard sound module, it sounds really muddy. If you get this and the sound is muddy to you, it's your sound module on your computer, you may need to buy an external soundcard (for laptops) or an internal soundcard (for desktops) in order for the captured input sound to well, sound clear and not muddy.
customer_reviews.author: PhillyTheCrazyGamer

customer_reviews.title: Quality product with quality sound.
customer_reviews.text: After testing the GoPro Hero7 with other mics as well as built in mic I have found this mic under stereo settings produces the best audio recording. The over all sound quality in my application (POV Recording) is warm and in the meduum range. The overall reach was surprisingly wide. I was able to make out conversations clearly both in front and behind me within 15' to 20' while clearly hearing the crisp trail sounds happening around me while riding. Well worth the investment. (NOTE) You must purchase the GoPro adapter for Hero 7 in order to use this mic. No other adaptors are needed.
customer_reviews.author: Product_Purchaser_1970

customer_reviews.title: Great in quiet rooms / Picks up everything in loud environments
customer_reviews.text: If you're in a quiet room, this microphone is an INCREDIBLE value for the money. You can get great, useable audio really easily. HOWEVER. If you aren't in a quiet room, this mic picks up every last wave of white noise, talking, etc. You should be conducting interviews (the only reason I bought this mic) in a quiet room anyways, so it shouldn't be a problem. Just know that if you're outside and a car drives by, the mic is going to pick it up big time. And the wind will be brutal. And the dude talking on his phone across the street will be audible. Just record in a quiet room/location with this mic and you'll love it ;)
customer_reviews.author: Ethan D.

customer_reviews.title: Very sensitive mic.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to put inside my full-face motorcycle helmet. This is a VERY sensitive mic. I'd seen this recommended by several youtubers who get great sound with the same application, but I lost everything to wind noise once I hit about 35 mph, no matter what kind of wind screen or dead cat I fashoned for it. It seems like it would be a great mic for presentations or recording conversations/podcasting/voiceovers /etc., just too sensitive for my situation.
customer_reviews.author: Al Quickel

customer_reviews.title: Good but terrible for motovlogging
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely horrible for motovlogging. It has great sound BUT put it in a helmet and it cracks at high speeds without talking. Even with a dead cat. Very sensitive. If you're into motovlogging avoid it no matter what GoPro says. It's on forums and YT channels to go another route. It's horrible for riding. Again, it does have great sound otherwise. Off to blow some more money now...
customer_reviews.author: Steve Steele

customer_reviews.title: The cord pretty much renders it useless for video
customer_reviews.text: I got it for vlogging with my GoPro but the cord is so short i couldn't possibly use it with the camera. when i tried to find out if there was a recommended cord extension "Dave" told me they hadn't tested anything and wouldn't recommend one. Nice. Thanks for the help. Guess I'll return this one and order a different one...
customer_reviews.author: Woidyla5

customer_reviews.title: Nice SONY, but not as good as the old ones.
customer_reviews.text: I bo't this new SONY clip on microphone because my old one (which I had for probably 15-20 yrs and used a lot) finally died. Comparing apples with apples, this particular Sony doesn't give as crisp a sound as my old one. Different technology? I don't know. It still does the trick and functions well, has a relatively loud record'g but NOT as loud or clear as my old Sony. All said and done, I wud still go w/Sony for the price and acceptable quality. Wud give this a 3.5 star but there R no decimals here to choose, so I went with the higher 4*.
customer_reviews.author: dp

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Best external mic for interviews or motorcycle riding. If you're using it on your motorcycle helmet, make sure to use a deadcat or foam to keep those anoying wind noises out. sound quality is very clear and loud enough. If you need to remove the clip, there's a screw right in the middle (gotta lift the top portion of the clip so you can see the screw) so you can take it off. I didn't know this until I just broke the clip on purpose. Still works great!
customer_reviews.author: GeEmWae8

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT work on a MacBook pro
customer_reviews.text: If you plug these into the stereo jack on a Macbook Pro, it will consider your mic to be headphones. Yes, I tried the Sound system prefs. Yes, I checked in my apps for a way to re-assign it. The bottom line is that, whatever standard by cheap Xbox headphones can handle in terms of plug-n-play on a Mac, Sony apparently chooses not to.
customer_reviews.author: T. Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good, but the cord looks cheap and will ultimately cause issues in the future
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is good enough for phone calls, online gaming, and other communication use cases, but I don't see this as a good alternative for a proper studio quality mic for video production, which I didn't want anyway. The build quality is...suspect. Everything is plastic, including the delicate clip which could wear out due to repeated use/stress. The cord itself is fairly short and feels like one of those 3.5mm jacks you get at the dollar store.
customer_reviews.author: SegmentationFault

customer_reviews.title: Too much static for good voice quality
customer_reviews.text: From opening, the microphone had enough static to match the volume of my voice. I listened to it through windows and would never use it for chatting as I don't think I would even be audible. It probably works better for clipping onto your short and recording videos through an iPhone. However, I would not recommend clipping it into a headset for gaming.
customer_reviews.author: max karp

customer_reviews.title: Voice quality is adequate, however, the range is ...
customer_reviews.text: Voice quality is adequate, however, the range is way too far, in my opinion. It will pick up everything in the room you are recording, which for most people buying a clip-on mic, is not the desired usage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt work for everything
customer_reviews.text: Wish I could use this but it doesn't work even with a adapter I'm gonna keep it hopefully it works on a camera
customer_reviews.author: santana

customer_reviews.title: A REAL GEM!
customer_reviews.text: Hard to believe that this $20 mic can hold its own against my $200 Rode Stereo Videomic Pro. The sound is full and rich - good enough for live music. Now I don't have to worry about battery life and the bulk anymore! My Panasonic GH3's internal mic's are very poor to the point of being unusable, so an external mic is always necessary. The Sony mic just blows them away and sounds as good as the Rode for just about every use. This may be one the biggest steals in the industry. That's how good I think this little mic is. Well done, Sony!
customer_reviews.author: T. Ishizue

customer_reviews.title: Works great- better than expensive models!
customer_reviews.text: I tried several lav mics for a wedding I was officiating on a beach. This unit outperformed all the others- by far. It is sensitive enough to actually capture and project your voice when clipped on your lav outdoors. I tried the more expensive Sennheiser and a handful of other higher priced models, but this thing worked way better than the others. I coupled this with a WinBridge WB001 Rechargeable Ultralight Portable Voice Amplifier unit and they performed beautifully on a beach where I spoke to about 100 people. Added just enough to allow my voice to project- the people in the back said that they hear me.
customer_reviews.author: Danny S

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: So if you need to boost sound while recording on your phone this little guy will work. It’s not perfect, but for a cheap mic it works well. I do have to use an adaptor. But knew that was a possibility. I’ve also used with my laptop and it works well there too.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany M. Hall

customer_reviews.title: This lav mic is a perfect complement to my VIXIA camcorder that I use for ...
customer_reviews.text: This lav mic is a perfect complement to my VIXIA camcorder that I use for filming unboxings and reviews! The normal mic was OK, but this thing clears up a lot of audio issues the camera has almost immediately. I also tried this with my TASCAM DR-05 and it worked well. I mean the TASCAM mics are beautiful alone, but this thing works well, especially if you need to set down the digital recorder. You won't hear the clunk of the device hitting the table like you just dropped a bucket of marbles and you won't lose audio quality with the recorder moving away from you.
customer_reviews.author: Curt L. Woodard

customer_reviews.title: Great mic for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for video conferencing and online gaming so I could keep using my regular headphones. Headsets have either terrible mics, or terrible sound. The best bet is simply to purchase the mic and headphones separately. I wanted to get a Modmic but it wasn't available for my country but this little Sony mic does the job really well. I bought a small TRRS adapter to be able to plug it into my Macbook Pro. My only complain is that the cable is a little too short.
customer_reviews.author: Pier

customer_reviews.title: Bad sound quality !
customer_reviews.text: Its cord is too short. If i fit it in the camera i need to stand close to the camera. Sound quality is disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Great Stereo Mic
customer_reviews.text: I go kayaking a lot and record my trips on action cameras. Since the waterproof boxes kill the camera sound, this is my audio. Not waterproof, but really impressed with the stereo sound quality. Gives a true sense of actually being out there when watching my videos.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Truitt Jr

customer_reviews.title: A+ audio for the money.
customer_reviews.text: This lav has a great output level which means a lower noise floor. Audio is clean and natural sounding and the capsule can be rotated on the clip to be used like a mono mic if you wish. It requires power from your audio recorder to power the capsules so cheap recorders may not be able to accommodate that, but my Tascam DR-05 does and so should the Zoom H1 or higher. My only complaint is that the clip doesn't have enough bite and comes loose from clothing under normal movement. Tape fixes that pretty easily, but it's still worth pointing out.
customer_reviews.author: Mick Swagger

customer_reviews.title: Sony ECMCS3 Clip style Omnidirectional Stereo Microphone
customer_reviews.text: I think its a fantastic Mic , it sounds as good as some mics costing 10 times as much , i use it on a Sony AX 53 camcorder , and it works great , I researched many mics on UTube , and this sounded the best , and it was only $ 25.00 , you cant beat it. sounded better than a $200 dollar rodes mic
customer_reviews.author: Jerry C. Cole

customer_reviews.title: Excellent audio, very convenient
customer_reviews.text: I use this as an external mic for my laptop, so I can do VoIP, skype and webex calls without a headset. Works very well, much better than the built-in mic, though slightly prone to echo. I noticed that putting a piece of tape over one end of the cylinder (i.e. covering one mic) reduces this effect, which is likely due to bounce off the wall against which my desk faces. I have suspended it from an overhead shelf to reduce any keyboard vibrations that might occur if clipped to the monitor. At some point I may use it for voice-to-text dictation as well.
customer_reviews.author: H. A. Newness

customer_reviews.title: purchased as part of a gaming headset alternative
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the,andas an alternative to a costly PS4 dedicated headset and I am very satisfied. I have all the functionality of a gaming headset with the versatility of using the headphones for music without looking like a doof with the microphone hanging off the side. The microphone audio is clear and does not catch plosive sounds because you're not directly speaking into it. Additionally, I can swap out components as necessary. I highly recommend this set up.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Replacement for a gaming headset.
customer_reviews.text: I use it as my main microphone for gaming voice chat. It works and the range on this is huge, other people can hear me when its 4 feet away, but when it's attached to the collar of my shirt, its not too loud for them. No distortion when the mic is at normal range. If you are 'eating' your mic, then yes it will be distortion, though I'd not see the possible unless the user was really trying to blow their opponent's ears out (which I don't condone).
customer_reviews.author: Vincent

customer_reviews.title: This clips and it works with a recorder. Coolness
customer_reviews.text: I like the twisted functionality of it. I like that I can wear it with almost anything. I do not like that it is reflective. But it works so darn well, I don't care. I just slip a cover on it and nobody can see it. Just a note though, concealing it in your hair when it is clipped to the ear doesn't work well because the hair can brush up against the microphone part. But so long as it is unobstructed, it works great. Highly recommend with the Zoom H1 PDR.
customer_reviews.author: Bucky

customer_reviews.title: Nice product.
customer_reviews.text: Not quite as great as what they pitch it to be, but still it's great to be able to have the recorder in your pocket but have this on your shirt collar and picks up everything clearly.
customer_reviews.author: ChazerC

customer_reviews.title: Sony ECM-CS3 microphone
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mic because it has a much shorter cord than my normal camera mic. The cord measured in at 3.5 feet, which is great for a lot of video work I do. Note you need a device that supplies 3.5 VDC power to the mic, as it doesn't have it's own battery. Fortunately, my Canon T3i has the capability to power the mic. Output is stereo and the connection is through a 90 degree plug (gold plated). Sound quality is good, but it does pick up a lot of environmental noise (background). You can see my youtube video review under redonkilaus if you so desire.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Curl aka RedonKiLaus

customer_reviews.title: Good mic for many purposes!
customer_reviews.text: This mic delivers excellent sound quality at a reasonable price. It is small and is good for applications where one is looking for an inconspicuous stereo microphone. Further it operates with a latge distance range and with many recorders, including my two Sony stereo IC recorders.
customer_reviews.author: Dave the Computer Kid

customer_reviews.title: Very flimsy. You can't plug this into a computer
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was a clip-mic for plugging into your computer while vlogging. No, it's actually for plugging into a video camcorder—which doesn't make much sense with a very short cord. Maybe if the videographer was narrarating while recording, à la Sir David Attenborough, it would be useful. However, the device itself is extremely flimsy and not sturdy at all. It isn't something you'd use outdoors, so I'm a bit lost on the practical applications.
customer_reviews.author: Misanthrope

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great, but limited compatability.
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is pretty darn good. Unfortunately, this mic requires plug-in-power. Phantom power adapters are around $50-70 - only get it if you're going to use it with a product that supports it; otherwise there are other products out there that will cost you less in the end. That said, it'll work with cellphones and at least some consumer soundcards (I have a creative E1 and it works) - but not "professional" audio interfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Someguy15

customer_reviews.title: Just What I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: It’s such a good microphone. The sound is so clear. I use for my YouTube videos. I had to get an adapter to use on my old phone to record audios. It was 6 dollars. Besides that situation, everything about this microphone is perfect. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Nohane Carvalho

customer_reviews.title: The LOUDEST so far but Requires PiP
customer_reviews.text: I have bought several inexpensive Lav mic's over the past several years. This Sony has become my favorite, Its the loudest and clearest so far. If you buy one be aware that it requires PiP (Plug in Power) which is the recording device like a camera supplying a very small amount of electrical current to anything plugged into its "mic" port. This feature is usually turned on and off from the menu. Many cameras as well as other recording devices DON'T supply PiP so this Mic wouldn't work with them. If your interested in this Mic make sure your device is compatible by supplying PiP. If it does I think you'd be very happy with this mic!
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: You Can't Beat This Mic For The Price
customer_reviews.text: Sony has always been known for making quality audio/video equipment, especially at the high end. But what's really always surprised me about them is how much quality and effort they put into even their most basic items. This is no exception. This mic isn't necessarily ideal on a windy day, or when a lot of stuff is going on in the background. However, in a quiet setting where you want to sit a certain distance from the camera or have freedom to move, I found this to be rather impressive. Especially when you consider the price. A fantastic choice as either a backup mic or even a primary one, if you're just starting out.
customer_reviews.author: Incoherent Drivel

customer_reviews.title: Lovely Audio
customer_reviews.text: I use this mic to record concerts and piano playing. Does a fantastic job. The local music teacher can't understand how I get such high fidelity with such small, simple equipment. I pair this with a Sony stereo digital recorder for the ultimate portable recording studio.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Hesitant at first....
customer_reviews.text: after reading a bunch of reviews I was a little hesitant buying this mic. Unfortunately, I tend to give few one star ratings more weight than large amounts of 5 stars. In this case though, I was pleasantly surprised. Straight forward to use and the sound quality is good. It is tighter with less background noise. Some say muffled, but not with my voice recorder. I use the tie clip with a Philips DVT/5000. It is compatible with no hoops to jump through to get it working. Just plug it in to the mic jack, and your set. For the price, it's good.
customer_reviews.author: interstellar audio network

customer_reviews.title: Cute and super great!
customer_reviews.text: Dudes, for the price this is great! It's cute and clips on, works well with my computer that I use with my elgato capture card. Give it a shot if your unsure of spending a lot on a standing mic. Had this for 4-5 months now and loving it.
customer_reviews.author: Katie aka KDizzle3

customer_reviews.title: Great mic, great price
customer_reviews.text: Works great connected to my computer. I actually have it sitting on top of my monitor rather than clipped onto my shirt. My friends hear me loud and clear. It does need a powered microphone port, a fact I didn't pay close enough attention to when buying this (computers do not have this feature), but luckily I had a mic+headphone to usb external sound card and it works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Walker86

customer_reviews.title: Good until it broke.
customer_reviews.text: Decent sound quality but it quit working after a few months. I'm very gentle with electronics. It never got wet, dusty, thrown around, or anything like that. It just stopped working for no obvious reason.
customer_reviews.author: D S

customer_reviews.title: Best lav out there
customer_reviews.text: Ok so this mic has the best stereo I’ve ever heard on a lav. I use it with my Tascam and get absolutely zero noise when I’m not speaking. It’s amazing. Much better than the purple panda mic or other competition. Do yourself a favor and try it out.
customer_reviews.author: Victor D.

customer_reviews.title: Decent if you can control its heightened recording level
customer_reviews.text: This microphone is too loud. It may be fine for recording devices that are adjustable, but for my Sony HandyCam, which only has High and Low for audio, even Low is way too loud. In post production it's real close to clipping and even after bringing it down about 5dB it's obvious this microphone is way too sensitive and bordering on overmodulation. I have to put it far down my shirt and be careful how loud I talk. The sound quality when not on the verge of distorting is very good as is the stereo separation. It would be perfect if they just dropped it 5dB in sensitivity.
customer_reviews.author: MountainCamping

customer_reviews.title: Professional
customer_reviews.text: This is a powerful little microphone that seemed to do a good job of isolating the speaker's voice without also picking up noises around the room. I used it with a small voice amplifier attached to my belt and there was a problem with feedback when the volume was turned near maximum. It may have been this mic was simply too sensitive for the amplifier, but with the volume turned down everything was fine. I was indoors so I can't say how it would be for wind noise or traffic noise, but it's the kind the TV pros use so I am sure it's fine.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Veley

customer_reviews.title: Worked for Speech meetings.
customer_reviews.text: We needed a mic for articulation detection on Zoom Speech meetings. If you need to be able to have more that one listener but an isolated speaker, this is better than a headset. It did help minimize background noise on the receiving end.
customer_reviews.author: I heart TX

customer_reviews.title: Great with ICD-PX312
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with a Sony Digital Flash Voice Recorder (ICD-PX312) and I have to say it works perfectly with it. I've tried to use it with other recorders that use stereo inputs, but I couldn't get them to work, maybe because the 1/4" adapter (not included) somehow doesn't make it work. Clip it to your shirt, put a sweater over it and record your surroundings without it sounding muffled at all. Since the left and right are so close together, it really isn't a true stereo mic (think of early Beatles stereo mixes), but more of a semi-stereo mic, which is still good.
customer_reviews.author: CJ Costa Rica

customer_reviews.title: Great little mic
customer_reviews.text: I work in a meat packing plant and do research. I needed a hands free mic to record measurements. It's extremely loud in the kind of large plant I work in so I was worried about hearing myself over the noise. It clips perfectly onto my coat and picks up my voice well over the machinery noises. Great quality for the price
customer_reviews.author: Maddy

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as expected
customer_reviews.text: This one doesn't work with any iPhones. It doesn't filter the sound. When you are in a noisy place, it can't illuminate your voice from other voices. You have to pull close to your mouth to get loud and clear sounds in the SILENCE place. Not a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Ulziibayar

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: I’m getting serious crackling out of this. I installed two muffs and I still get it
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound, Very Sensitive
customer_reviews.text: Tried this out the other day and wowzers is it great. I clipped it to the front of my collar (at the base of my neck) and it recorded my voice perfectly, even if I talked at a low volume. It is very sensitive which was surprising, even capturing the swoosh of my pants as I walked around the house. I did note that it picked up a slight breeze, so in windy conditions in might not be so great.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Graham

customer_reviews.title: Bought it for a friend, im reviewing now cause ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for a friend , im reviewing now cause i give product a chance to be tested first , it has a solid quality in audio , no problem or whatsoever they had drop it 5 times , and it hasn't been damaged , im surprised this little thing can do the job. but beware of spilling water on it, it might damaged some components inside , and dont go with it on a rainy day. you have been warned , thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Pichardo Linares

customer_reviews.title: great sound for the buck
customer_reviews.text: Being a small-diaphragm, and $20, the mid-range is elusive and the low-end is absent- but that is to be expected. For $20, great sound for the buck! CONS: cable is VERY short. It picks up rustle very easily too, so I am nervous to be animated when speaking with it. I'll update this review as time passes. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Brett A. Tomadin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me!
customer_reviews.text: I find no problems with this microphone. I don't know if they would be good for other applications, but for skyping and chatting, this is a nice one for the price. I like that I can just clip this on instead of having another piece of equipment taking up space on my desk. The only problem I had originally was figuring out how to make sure it was picking up sound from the right source. This is the first time I've ever used a mic, so I had no idea I had to make sure to set my computer to the headset microphone setting, and make sure the mic in my camera was off.
customer_reviews.author: jazzlovesmimi

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Microphone!
customer_reviews.text: If you need to use this on an iPhone however, you'll need to get a TRRS adapter to make it work but other than that, the audio on this is very clear. My voice never sounded so good!
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Works great for motovlogging.
customer_reviews.text: I used this mic with my gopro and the gopro microphone adapter. I made a pretty hefty dead cat to get rid of excessive wind noise when riding on my motorcycle and it performs superbly.
customer_reviews.author: Mike K.

customer_reviews.title: It works but requires power
customer_reviews.text: It does work but unfortunately it does require inline power unless your device has a powered mic in port like a PC. It does not work stand alone with a Canon HF R600. I'm going to keep it because it will be one of those things that someone I know down the road might be able to use or I'll find a use for it but for plugging directly into a camcorder that does not have a powered mic port, it will not work. When I had it plugged into my computer the sound quality is pretty good it's even a little too sensitive in my opinion which is why I docked a star.
customer_reviews.author: Djones

customer_reviews.title: Needs an adapter for Samsung Galaxy S5 and wouldn't work with Cannon camcorder
customer_reviews.text: The sound is good but CONS: for Android Samsung Galaxy S5 it didn't work until I plugged it in via an adapter (3 contacts to 4 contacts, I believe the adapter would be called female TRS to male TRRS). Once plugged in via an adapter, worked fine, nice sound quality. CONS2: wouldn't work with Canon FS100 or R600 camcorders - I believe the camcorders don't supply the phantom mic power and this ECMCS3 needs phantom power to power its mic. If you know how to solve these problems, please comment.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: It's lasted longer than all of my gaming headset microphones
customer_reviews.text: Despite the extremely short cord on this microphone and the fact it picks up all sound -- including your typing -- it works the way it's supposed to. This is a great multi-use microphone that I use when I'm between gaming headsets if the microphone goes out yet the earphones still work. For use with any and all voice chat software, recommended. Just sucks the cord is so short.
customer_reviews.author: Xavier Tristan

customer_reviews.title: Holy crap amazing audio quality!
customer_reviews.text: So I've gotten 3 of these, one I lost, one I use, and one is a backup(I loose things). I record with a Zoom H1 and this sounds amazing though it. I was a little worried, I thought I'd need an expensive mic to get good audio but this is amazing. I can't say enough good things about it, I only wished that Sony made a water proof version.
customer_reviews.author: S. Moon

customer_reviews.title: Better Than Rode, Great for Youtube
customer_reviews.text: Incredible sound! The cord is a bit short but an extension cable is cheap and easy to find. We love this for our YouTube videos. Better sound and more reliable than our expensive Rode microphone.
customer_reviews.author: HORROR ADDICTS

customer_reviews.title: Sounds good, short-ish cable, needs slight gain boost if not running through a pre-amp.
customer_reviews.text: Sounds good for the money. Needs a little gain, even when plugged into a Sabrent USB DAC, but works fine once you start speaking. Cable microphonics are nearly non-existent, as long as the mic itself isn't snagging on clothing. A wind furry helps tremendously. Useable cable length is a bit on the short side (around 37.5" or 98 cm) so expect to wire it up to a longer 3.5mm extension (even if wired into a belt pack) if you're moving about a lot, accounting for body motion and some cable slack.
customer_reviews.author: Reuben Yeong

customer_reviews.title: Great for go pro hero 7
customer_reviews.text: Great for go pro 7 !! Plug and play is all I did. Crisp and clear. When riding my dirt bike, I had to put a wind sock or dead cat over the mic to significantly reduce wind noise. Other than that, zero issues and recognizes voice commands. Ronnie
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent little mike
customer_reviews.text: We use this mike with Sony's micro recorder to record sermons and the combination works very well. The sound quality is great and the design allows fixing it easily to any shirt, coat or sweater. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best product available for the price - hands down
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this microphone to record a video for a scholarship application. It was extremely important to get the best quality I could without spending too much money. After watching/reading several reviews, I decided on this microphone and was NOT disappointed. It's easy to use and (most importantly) the sound quality is comparable to much pricier products. I highly recommend this product as I can't find a single thing to complain about with it and it far surpassed my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Pixi

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good quality for the money
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality on these is pretty good, much much better than the mics that come on gaming headsets. Just have to be careful to remember to remove it before you get up. I broke the last one I had that way but luckily theyre cheap so I just ordered another.
customer_reviews.author: T4keTheShot

customer_reviews.title: Great little microphone
customer_reviews.text: I got this to work with my old, trusty Sony ICD-UX512. Works great. Pick up is great, and so is the quality. Clips on nice and strong to my shirt. I have to set the microphone pick up to low, otherwise it picks up everything around me. I would have liked the cord to be a little thicker. It seems fragile and I'm not sure how long it would last. Also, the plug is one of those L-shaped ones, so when I put the recorder in my pocket it has to bend upwards. I would have preferred a straight plug.
customer_reviews.author: Sachin

customer_reviews.title: Love the price and quality but...
customer_reviews.text: I love this mic so much.. Sound Quality, Price, and looks... but it does not come with windscreen. It would have been perfect! I'm deducting 1 star because of that.
customer_reviews.author: JKM

customer_reviews.title: Garbage Microphone
customer_reviews.text: The microphone is so quiet that it barely registers even when amplified at the max setting. At that point, the static was so great that you can't hear anything else.
customer_reviews.author: el

customer_reviews.title: Great Starting and Professional microphone
customer_reviews.text: What I like about this mic: Amazing Sound quality for the price. Very budget friendly but can also be used in higher value productions. The only bad thing is how short the cable is, sometimes I don't feel like syncing up the audio with a recorder. And if I plug it directly into my vlog set up it is on the shorter side but is not that bad. But I can't stop mentioning the bang for the buck, it's incredible!
customer_reviews.author: Syed A Rizvi

customer_reviews.title: It's alright
customer_reviews.text: The sound is definitely overhyped. I would return it if I could because I only bought it with the expectation that it was going to be better than my headset mic (which it is not). The sound is very low and doesn't pick up my voice from far away (like maybe a foot away from my mouth). It was also impossible to get it to work with my laptop. If anyone has any tips on that let me know.
customer_reviews.author: Nadia

customer_reviews.title: Works great in the car with Samsung S4
customer_reviews.text: Using it as external microphone with Samsung S4. It is nearly impossible to hear car noise even when used at highway speeds. Following combination(s) working great: Samsung S4 + Sony ECMCS3 + Rockit Headphone/Microphone Splitter (or Conwork Headset Jack Adapter Splitter) + Shure SE215-K (likely working with any headset) Combination NOT working: Movo PM10 Deluxe Lavalier Lapel Clip-on Omnidirectional Condenser Microphone does NOT work in any of the combinations above; since everything else is working fine, I am pretty sure it is the Movo microphone that has a problem (wiring?)
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Great sound!
customer_reviews.text: Really good sound on this, worked with my Sony A6300 camera. Beware though, tape the microphone to the person's clothes and don't let it rub against clothes or hair or it will put scratchy sounds into the audio. Test, test test! I learned the hard way.
customer_reviews.author: MeBee

customer_reviews.title: Good tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought two and use them both. As a Lav Mic. they pick up a lot of distant sound (aka noise). Quality is great, but sensitive. I have to set the gain setting very differently compared to my traditional tiny lav mic. Priced right, I've used it hanging from a drop ceiling tile above the "talent" good for interview of a group conversation without the need to mic everyone in some situations.
customer_reviews.author: VPW

customer_reviews.title: All in all, a great first time lapel mic.
customer_reviews.text: It's a great microphone! Works well and clear. The output is actually a little too loud and I find I have to keep the microphone away to keep clipping out of the audio. All in all, a great first time lapel mic (does not work with my tablet, however. You will need a dedicated voice recorder as far as I know).
customer_reviews.author: TheBarnetts

customer_reviews.title: Works really good
customer_reviews.text: This little clip on mic is great! The mic is small and can easily clip on a tie or collar and has an excellent sound. You can easily plug this into a Mic port on a recorder (I am using a little RCA recorder), and record excellent sound, without getting a lot of a static and noise from wind. This little thing works great, is small, and has a great sound pickup. I really like it and it saves me a lot of time over trying to remove background noise from my videos in iMovie. Highly recommend for anyone who is recording video or recording audio presentations. Great price and great item (plus it is Sony)!!!!
customer_reviews.author: David Bradshaw

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for GoPro Hero3+ and Hero4
customer_reviews.text: This mic is recommended by GoPro and works perfectly with my Hero3+ and Hero4. The level is a little higher than the camera mic and to me the Sony ECMCS3 sounds richer. Signal-to-noise is excellent with no background hash. The cable is 42 inches long and can be easily extended with a 3.5mm shielded extension cable. For the Hero3+ and Hero4 you will need to get a GoPro Mic Adapter Cable found here on Amazon. This is great mic at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Spicerpro

customer_reviews.title: Good, but can't find a dead cat to fit.
customer_reviews.text: Sounds great. Works in stereo with my H1. Only issue is there's no properly sized dead cat I can find to fit it. So it's only useful indoors. Like any electret condenser mic, it gets blasted by any wind or breath. Have to keep it indoors and away from 'plosives.'
customer_reviews.author: J. Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Great lapel mic - get two windscreens!
customer_reviews.text: I like to make YouTube videos where I'm standing pretty far from the camera, and this mic, plus my Olympus LS10, plus two wind screens for each side of the mic make that very possible. The audio isn't as good as if I'm talking directly into my Samson C01U USB mic, but it's still very rich and clear, and makes for great voiceovers / audio tracks on videos.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Friday

customer_reviews.title: Best Bang for the Buck on a Clip-On
customer_reviews.text: I was blown away by this mic's quality. I used it for a couple projects where I narrated in front of a camera and I found the raw audio didn't need any post-processing aside from basic compression. I like to use this sometimes instead of my more expensive mics just so I don't have to run an XLR somewhere, and can just clip my my Zoom h4n to my pocket and start recording. I have no complaints whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon CustomerTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: It is a good only for digital recorder that can accept mono jacks.
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't use and test this product. I wanted to connect it to my Sony digital recorder which is already stereo. The ECMCS3's jack disconnected my built in Mics but since the jack is not for stereo connection, it couldn't make proper contact and record anything. I was wrong in my original assessment of the ECMCS3 to order. I wish they state the fact in their advertisement that the jack is not capable of handling digital recorders that cannot accept mono jacks.
customer_reviews.author: Gloyola
